s.text: The new glossy would serve as a launching pad for articles that could later be turned into films or television shows.
Rioters suspect the government of killing Abiola, and close to 20 people have died already.
Among the arguments for boarding the dot-wagon: dots take less space than hyphens, and the period key is easier to hit on the keyboard.
In response, Nigeria's military leader appealed for calm, and has promised that two U.S. doctors will be brought in to perform a fair autopsy for Abiola.
